results.description: Use pcr_oi_10 cross-sectionally to capture relative put-call open-interest skew; SUGGESTION1: single high-signal field used to keep implementation short; SUGGESTION2: not applicable (field is scalar); SUGGESTION3: coverage >0.6 so no ts_backfill; SUGGESTION4: pcr_oi_10 has reasonable user/alpha counts so applied; KEPT constraints (<=2 datafields, <=7 operators). Confidence: 0.70
Use pcr_oi_20 cross-sectionally to identify relative OI sentiment; applied SUGGESTION4 where possible; vector/ts-backfill not used for reasons above; obeyed KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence: 0.68
Cross-sectional zscore of pcr_oi_30 to capture option market skew across names; used single high-quality field to keep implementation compact per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence: 0.69

Cross-sectional zscore on pcr_oi_60 targeting medium-term OI sentiment differences; didn't use ts_backfill (coverage>0.6); SUGGESTION1 partially considered but kept to one field for brevity. Confidence: 0.66
zscore(pcr_oi_90) to isolate relative longer-dated OI positioning; followed KEEP_IN_MIND on operator/datafield limits; SUGGESTION4 moderate counts applied. Confidence: 0.67
Cross-sectional ranking of pcr_oi_120 to detect longer-term structural put-call skew differences; no vector ops needed. Confidence: 0.65
zscore(pcr_oi_150) for relative OI bias at this tenor; simplicity maintained per KEEP_IN_MIND; SUGGESTION3 not required. Confidence: 0.62
zscore(pcr_oi_180) to detect mid-term OI positioning across names; used field with high user/alpha counts when possible (applied SUGGESTION4). Confidence: 0.70
zscore(pcr_oi_270) — leverage very high userCount/alphaCount (applied SUGGESTION4) to capture persistent skew across names. Higher confidence due to broad adoption. Confidence: 0.85
zscore(pcr_oi_360) to capture long-tenor OI imbalance cross-sectionally; coverage good so no backfill required. Confidence: 0.63
zscore(pcr_oi_720) for very long-dated open-interest skew cross-sectional signal; kept to single field for concision. Confidence: 0.60
zscore(pcr_oi_1080) to highlight extreme long-term OI positioning across names; lower userCount so slightly lower confidence. Confidence: 0.58
ts_zscore(pcr_oi_10,20) measures unusual recent shifts in short-tenor OI for a name (momentum/mean-reversion in OI). SUGGESTION1: single-field time-series; SUGGESTION3 not needed. Confidence: 0.66
ts_zscore(pcr_oi_20,20) to detect rapid change in mid-short OI; used time-window 20d as generic lookback. Confidence: 0.64
ts_zscore(pcr_oi_30,20) identifies names with unusual 30d OI behavior relative to their history. Simplicity maintained per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence: 0.65
ts_zscore(pcr_oi_60,30) captures longer build-up or unwinding in OI (30-day lookback). SUGGESTION4: used maturities with reasonable user counts. Confidence: 0.63
ts_zscore(pcr_oi_90,30) to detect sustained shifts in 90d OI trend. No vectors used. Confidence: 0.62
ts_zscore(pcr_oi_120,40) to find persistent changes in longer tenor OI; longer lookback 40d chosen for smoother signal. Confidence: 0.60
ts_zscore(pcr_oi_150,40) for 150d tenor momentum in OI; applied KEEP_IN_MIND constraints. Confidence: 0.58
ts_zscore(pcr_oi_180,40) to detect medium-long term OI moves; coverage OK so no backfill. Confidence: 0.61
ts_zscore(pcr_oi_270,60) for long-tenor OI unusual moves; pcr_oi_270 has very high userCount/alphaCount so SUGGESTION4 applied — raises confidence. Confidence: 0.80
ts_zscore(pcr_oi_360,60) to find names with extreme long-tenor OI shifts; used larger lookback to reduce noise. Confidence: 0.59
ts_zscore(pcr_oi_720,80) long-horizon OI anomaly detection; fewer users so lower confidence. Confidence: 0.56
ts_zscore(pcr_oi_1080,80) longest-tenor OI unusual move detection; low userCount reduces confidence. Confidence: 0.52
zscore(pcr_vol_10) to detect names with relatively high put-call trading volume; SUGGESTION4: used fields with acceptable counts; vector not relevant. Confidence: 0.63
zscore(pcr_vol_20) cross-sectional ranking of put/call trade volume imbalance; kept single datafield per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence: 0.60
zscore(pcr_vol_30) to find names with relatively heavy put trading vs calls this tenor; simple, robust. Confidence: 0.61
zscore(pcr_vol_60) cross-sectional signal for medium-term put/call volume imbalance; no ts_backfill needed. Confidence: 0.59
zscore(pcr_vol_90) to capture relatively elevated put volume for the 90d tenor; kept field-only design. Confidence: 0.58
zscore(pcr_vol_120) ranking for longer-dated volume imbalance; lower coverage/userCount reduces confidence slightly. Confidence: 0.55
zscore(pcr_vol_180) to find names with strong long-tenor trading skew by volume; simple implementation respects constraints. Confidence: 0.56
zscore(pcr_vol_270) for cross-sectional long-tenor volume imbalance; pcr_vol_270 has moderate counts. Confidence: 0.62
ts_zscore(pcr_vol_10,20) detects recent spikes in put vs call trading activity for short tenor; used time-series operator per SUGGESTION1. Confidence: 0.61
ts_zscore(pcr_vol_30,20) to catch abrupt changes in 30d put/call volume behavior; vector suggestions not applicable. Confidence: 0.60
ts_zscore(pcr_vol_60,30) smoother detection of changes in put/call volume for medium tenor; kept implementation compact. Confidence: 0.58
ts_zscore(pcr_vol_90,40) to measure longer-term unusual volume shifts in 90d contracts; applied longer lookback for stability. Confidence: 0.56
ts_zscore(pcr_vol_120,40) for long-tenor traded-volume anomalies; modest confidence due to lower counts. Confidence: 0.54

subtract(forward_price_30, forward_price_10) to capture steepening/flattening between 10d and 30d forward—used two datafields per KEEP_IN_MIND2; SUGGESTION1 applied (combined fields). Confidence: 0.66
subtract(forward_price_90, forward_price_30) as slope proxy between 30d and 90d forward prices; two datafields, few operators. Confidence: 0.64
subtract(forward_price_270, forward_price_90) to capture term-structure slope; SUGGESTION4 used to pick tenors with robust counts. Confidence: 0.67
subtract(forward_price_90, forward_price_10) simple slope indicator between immediate and 3-month forward; short and long tenors combined per SUGGESTION1. Confidence: 0.65
subtract(forward_price_360, forward_price_60) to capture steepness to deep tenor; kept to two fields and one operator. Confidence: 0.61
subtract(forward_price_720, forward_price_120) captures long-term term-structure distortions; coverage acceptable. Confidence: 0.59
subtract(forward_price_30, forward_price_360) another slope metric across mid and long tenors; obeyed operator/datafield limits. Confidence: 0.60
subtract(forward_price_10, forward_price_270) to detect extreme short vs long forward disparity; simple and compact. Confidence: 0.62
divide(subtract(forward_price_90, forward_price_10), forward_price_10) normalizes slope to price level (two datafields, two operators) — SUGGESTION1 used to combine fields. Confidence: 0.66
divide(subtract(forward_price_270, forward_price_30), forward_price_30) normalized long-short slope; kept within operator/datafield limits. Confidence: 0.65
divide(subtract(forward_price_360, forward_price_60), forward_price_60) to measure term slope per unit price; simple normalization applied. Confidence: 0.60
divide(subtract(forward_price_720, forward_price_120), forward_price_120) long-term normalized slope; lower counts reduce confidence. Confidence: 0.57
divide(subtract(forward_price_30, forward_price_10), forward_price_10) short-tenor normalized slope; compact implementation. Confidence: 0.64
divide(subtract(forward_price_10, forward_price_270), forward_price_10) extreme short-vs-long normalized slope; kept to two fields. Confidence: 0.62
subtract(call_breakeven_30, put_breakeven_30) to capture skew of implied strike breakevens — two datafields used per SUGGESTION1; no ts_backfill needed. Confidence: 0.68
subtract(call_breakeven_10, put_breakeven_10) short-tenor breakeven skew; straightforward implementation in one operator. Confidence: 0.70
subtract(call_breakeven_60, put_breakeven_60) mid-tenor breakeven skew; used high-coverage fields. Confidence: 0.66
subtract(call_breakeven_90, put_breakeven_90) to detect directional bias implied by option breakevens at 90d. Confidence: 0.65
subtract(call_breakeven_120, put_breakeven_120) longer-dated implied skew measure; maintained constraints. Confidence: 0.62
subtract(call_breakeven_180, put_breakeven_180) for medium-long tenor implied skew; simplicity favored. Confidence: 0.61
subtract(call_breakeven_270, put_breakeven_270) long-tenor breakeven skew; applied SUGGESTION4 if possible. Confidence: 0.63
subtract(call_breakeven_360, put_breakeven_360) deep-tenor breakeven skew; lower user counts slightly reduce confidence. Confidence: 0.58

subtract(option_breakeven_30, forward_price_30) measures divergence between option-implied breakeven and synthetic forward — two fields used per SUGGESTION1; can highlight mispricing. Confidence: 0.67
subtract(option_breakeven_10, forward_price_10) short-tenor divergence metric; concise implementation follows KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence: 0.69
subtract(option_breakeven_60, forward_price_60) for medium-tenor mispricing signals; single operator, two fields. Confidence: 0.64
subtract(option_breakeven_90, forward_price_90) captures structural differences between breakeven and forward at 90d. Confidence: 0.63
subtract(option_breakeven_120, forward_price_120) for longer-tenor divergence detection; applied SUGGESTION4 where tenors have acceptable counts. Confidence: 0.60
subtract(option_breakeven_270, forward_price_270) long-tenor mispricing indicator; simple two-field design. Confidence: 0.62

ts_rank(pcr_oi_270,5) to detect recent relative ranking momentum in long-tenor OI; uses time-series rank to identify sustained directional moves. SUGGESTION3 not needed; confident due to high counts. Confidence: 0.78
ts_rank(pcr_oi_180,5) identifies recent momentum of 180d OI ranking; simple, within operator limits. Confidence: 0.65
ts_rank(pcr_oi_90,5) short/medium tenor OI ranking momentum signal; kept minimal. Confidence: 0.64
ts_rank(pcr_oi_60,5) detects recent 2-week momentum in OI ranking for 60d tenor. Confidence: 0.62
ts_rank(pcr_oi_30,5) short-tenor OI momentum cross-sectionally measured over 5 days. Confidence: 0.63
ts_rank(pcr_oi_10,5) very short-tenor OI ranking momentum for anomaly detection; simple implementation. Confidence: 0.61
ts_rank(pcr_oi_360,10) longer lookback for long-tenor ranking momentum (10-day rank) to smooth noise. Confidence: 0.58
ts_rank(pcr_oi_120,7) mid-long tenor recent ranking momentum over 7 days. Confidence: 0.59
ts_returns(forward_price_10,5) to capture short-run momentum in implied forward — single datafield time-series operator used per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence: 0.60
ts_returns(forward_price_20,5) 5-day return on 20d forward as a momentum signal; kept concise. Confidence: 0.59
ts_returns(forward_price_30,5) 5-day forward return for 30d tenor momentum; simple and implementable. Confidence: 0.58
ts_returns(forward_price_60,7) 7-day forward return on 60d tenor; slightly longer lookback for stability. Confidence: 0.56
ts_returns(forward_price_90,7) captures momentum in 90d implied forward; single-field time-series approach. Confidence: 0.55
ts_returns(forward_price_270,10) long-tenor forward momentum over 10 days to capture structural shifts; lower confidence due to noise. Confidence: 0.53

subtract(zscore(pcr_oi_270), zscore(pcr_vol_270)) — measure mismatch between open-interest skew and trading-volume skew at 270d; used two fields and two zscores then subtract (<=7 ops). SUGGESTION1 combined fields; vector not applicable. Confidence: 0.72
subtract(zscore(pcr_oi_180), zscore(pcr_vol_180)) measures OI/volume discord at 180d; consistent with constraints. Confidence: 0.66
subtract(zscore(pcr_oi_90), zscore(pcr_vol_90)) short/medium-tenor discrepancy between persistent OI and transient volume — useful for predicting reversion. Confidence: 0.65
subtract(zscore(pcr_oi_30), zscore(pcr_vol_30)) captures mismatch between accumulated OI and recent trading activity at 30d; follows KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence: 0.64
subtract(zscore(pcr_oi_10), zscore(pcr_vol_10)) short-tenor mismatch may indicate transient flows vs structural positioning; compact implementation. Confidence: 0.63
subtract(zscore(pcr_oi_60), zscore(pcr_vol_60)) medium-tenor divergence between OI and volume; kept to two datafields and three operators max. Confidence: 0.62
subtract(option_breakeven_30, option_breakeven_10) to capture term-structure in implied breakeven prices; two fields, single op. SUGGESTION1 used to combine maturities. Confidence: 0.65
subtract(option_breakeven_90, option_breakeven_30) longer-term breakeven slope as signal of changing market expectations across tenors. Confidence: 0.63
subtract(option_breakeven_270, option_breakeven_90) captures long-term shifts in implied breakevens; simple and within operator limits. Confidence: 0.62
subtract(put_breakeven_30, put_breakeven_10) to detect accelerating downside breakevens — two fields only; SUGGESTION2 not applicable. Confidence: 0.64
subtract(call_breakeven_30, call_breakeven_10) to detect accelerating upside breakevens; compact one-operator implementation. Confidence: 0.63
zscore(pcr_vol_all) cross-sectional ranking of aggregated put/call volume across maturities; SUGGESTION1 used to pick the aggregated field; high-level signal. Confidence: 0.62
zscore(pcr_oi_all) cross-sectional ranking of total OI put/call across maturities; aggregated field helps capture broad sentiment per SUGGESTION1. Confidence: 0.70

results.idea: Option breakeven all minus forward all
results.description: subtract(option_breakeven_10, forward_price_10) used as proxy for all-tenor mismatch (implemented at short-tenor as representative); kept to two fields; SUGGESTION3 not needed. Confidence: 0.66
subtract(put_breakeven_60, forward_price_60) to capture downside implied price vs synthetic forward misalignment; two fields used. Confidence: 0.61
subtract(call_breakeven_60, forward_price_60) upside implied price vs synthetic forward divergence; compact implementation per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence: 0.60
ts_delta(pcr_oi_30,5) measures recent change in pcr_oi_30 (today - 5d ago) as short-term impulse; SUGGESTION1 used single field for parsimony. Confidence: 0.62
ts_delta(pcr_vol_30,5) short-term volume impulse at 30d; simple and fits operator/data limits. Confidence: 0.60

subtract(ts_zscore(forward_price_30,20), ts_zscore(option_breakeven_30,20)) compares recent deviations in forward vs breakeven; uses two time-series ops and one subtract (<=7). SUGGESTION1 used to combine two complementary fields. Confidence: 0.68
zscore(pcr_oi_720) highlight names with unusually high long-term put-call OI concentration; implemented as single-field cross-sectional zscore. Confidence: 0.56
ts_zscore(pcr_vol_10,10) identifies abrupt short-tenor put buying spikes that often precede mean reversion; SUGGESTION4: field counts moderate. Confidence: 0.63
divide(subtract(forward_price_30, forward_price_10), forward_price_30) normalized steepening measure (two fields, two ops) — compact and interpretable. Confidence: 0.64
divide(subtract(forward_price_270, forward_price_90), forward_price_270) captures long-end flattening relative to mid; concise two-field template. Confidence: 0.63

results.idea: Call heavy breakeven vs calls OI mismatch (30d)
results.description: subtract(zscore(call_breakeven_30), zscore(call_breakeven_10)) cross-tenor mismatch in call breakevens indicating changing upside conviction; two fields used, within limits. Confidence: 0.61

results.idea: Put heavy breakeven vs puts OI mismatch (30d)
results.description: subtract(zscore(put_breakeven_30), zscore(put_breakeven_10)) cross-tenor put breakeven divergence; simple and compact. Confidence: 0.60
ts_av_diff(pcr_oi_30,20) measures deviation from rolling mean for 30d OI — good for mean-reversion trades; single field, one operator. Confidence: 0.62
ts_av_diff(pcr_vol_30,20) deviation from 20d mean in volume imbalance; compact single-field implementation. Confidence: 0.59
ts_av_diff(forward_price_270,60) measures long-term forward divergence from its recent mean — target reversion trades. Confidence: 0.58
ts_kurtosis(option_breakeven_30,60) detects abnormal tail behavior in breakeven history suggesting episodic risk; single-field time-series statistic. Confidence: 0.54
ts_ir(pcr_oi_270,60) information ratio of 270d PCR indicating stable vs noisy skew—uses single field time-series op. SUGGESTION4 applied due to high alpha/user counts. Confidence: 0.71
ts_std_dev(forward_price_90,30) elevated volatility in implied forward can predict larger moves; single-field, limited operators. Confidence: 0.60
